capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE

app_metadata.description: A file sharing server that puts the control and security of your own data back into your hands.
app_metadata.name: nextcloud

run_as_context.description: Redis runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Nextcloud

attrs.label: Postgres Image (CAUTION)
attrs.description:
If you are changing this after the postgres directory has been initialized,</br>
STOP! and make sure you have a backup of your data.</br>
Changing this will trigger an one way database upgrade.</br>
You can only select newer versions of postgres.</br>
Selecting an older version will refuse to start.</br>
If something goes wrong, you will have to restore from backup.

attrs.label: Admin User
attrs.description: The admin user for Nextcloud.

attrs.label: Admin Password
attrs.description: The admin password for Nextcloud.

attrs.label: APT Packages
attrs.description:
The APT packages to install.</br>
For additional packages, please open an issue on GitHub.</br>
Sources and documentation links can help expedite the process.

attrs.label: Tesseract Language Codes
attrs.description:
The tesseract languages to install for OCRmypdf.</br>
See a list of language codes here https://tesseract-ocr.github.io/tessdoc/Data-Files-in-different-versions.html.</br>
Typing a wrong language code will block the container from starting.</br>
Only takes effect if ocrmypdf is selected above.

attrs.label: Imaginary
attrs.description:
Imaginary can help improve performance for generating image previews.</br>
Please see https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/latest/admin_manual/installation/server_tuning.html#previews for more information.</br>

attrs.label: Enabled
attrs.description: Enable Imaginary

attrs.label: Host
attrs.description:
Nextcloud host to create application URLs</br>
Examples: </br>
cloud.domain.com:30001</br>
cloud.domain.com (if you use port 443 externally)</br>
192.168.1.100:9001 (replace ip and port with your own)</br></br>
This will be appended to the trusted domains list, but changing that will not remove it from the list.</br>

attrs.label: Data Directory Path
attrs.description:
Configures the data directory where Nextcloud stores all files from the users.
The path refers to the path inside the container</br>
It is recommended to keep the default value. (/var/www/html/data)

attrs.label: Redis Password
attrs.description: The password for Redis.

attrs.label: Database User
attrs.description: The user for the database.

attrs.label: Database Password
attrs.description: The password for the database.

attrs.label: PHP Upload Limit (in GB)
attrs.description:
Applies the timeout to the following settings:</br>
- client_max_body_size in nginx</br>
- post_max_size and upload_max_filesize in php</br>

attrs.label: Max Execution Time (in seconds)
attrs.description: The max execution time for Nextcloud.

attrs.label: PHP Memory Limit (in MB)
attrs.description: The PHP memory limit.

attrs.label: Op Cache Interned Strings Buffer (in MB)
attrs.description: The Op Cache interned strings buffer.

attrs.label: Op Cache Memory Consumption (in MB)
attrs.description: The Op Cache memory consumption.

attrs.label: Cron
attrs.description: The cron schedule.

attrs.label: Enabled
attrs.description: Enable cron.

attrs.label: Schedule
attrs.description: The cron schedule.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: DNS Options
attrs.description:
DNS options for the container.</br>
Format: key:value</br>
Example: attempts:3

attrs.label: Certificate ID
attrs.description: The certificate ID to use for Nextcloud.

attrs.label: Nginx Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the Nginx.

attrs.label: Proxy Timeout
attrs.description:
Applies the timeout to the following settings:</br>
- proxy_connect_timeout</br>
- proxy_send_timeout</br>
- proxy_read_timeout</br>

attrs.label: Use different port for URL rewrites
attrs.description:
If enabled, the URL rewrite will use [Access Port] defined below instead of the [Node Port].</br>
Note that Nextcloud will still listen on the [Node Port]. (Default 9001)

attrs.label: External Port
attrs.description: The external port for Nginx.

attrs.label: Custom Nginx Configurations
attrs.description: List of custom Nginx configurations.

attrs.label: Nextcloud AppData Storage (HTML, Custom Themes, Apps, etc.)
attrs.description: The path to store Nextcloud HTML and AppData.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Nextcloud User Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Nextcloud User Data.

attrs.description: The path to store Nextcloud Postgres Data.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: SMB Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the SMB dataset.

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: The server to mount the SMB share.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: The path to mount the SMB share.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: The username to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Domain
attrs.description: The domain to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Containers
attrs.description: Containers where the label should be applied

attrs.label: CPUs
attrs.description: CPUs limit for Nextcloud.

attrs.label: Memory (in MB)
attrs.description: Memory limit for Nextcloud.

2.0.25.readme:
Nextcloud

Nextcloud is a file sharing server that puts the control and security of your own data back into your hands.
